verses.kjv: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
verses.ct: A wise woman builds up her household, but a foolish one tears it apart with her own hands.

verses.kjv: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
verses.ct: Someone who lives with integrity is wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD, but a person whose ways are crooked despises him.

verses.kjv: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
verses.ct: The talk of a fool brings a rod of arrogance, but the words of the wise protect them.

verses.kjv: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
verses.ct: When there are no oxen, the feeding trough stays empty, but a strong ox produces an abundant harvest.

verses.kjv: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.
verses.ct: A trustworthy witness won't tell lies, but a dishonest witness pours out deception.

verses.kjv: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.
verses.ct: A mocker searches for wisdom but never finds it, yet knowledge comes easily to someone with understanding.

verses.kjv: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.
verses.ct: Stay away from a foolish person, because you won't find any knowledgeable words coming from them.

verses.kjv: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.
verses.ct: The wisdom of a careful thinker helps them understand their path, but the stupidity of fools is self-deception.

verses.kjv: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.
verses.ct: Fools laugh at the idea of sin, but goodwill is found among those who do right.

verses.kjv: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.
verses.ct: Each person's heart knows its own grief, and no outsider can fully share in its joy.

verses.kjv: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.
verses.ct: The household of the wicked will be destroyed, but the dwelling of the upright will thrive.

verses.kjv: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
verses.ct: There is a path that seems right to a person, but it ultimately leads to death.

verses.kjv: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
verses.ct: Even during laughter the heart can ache, and celebration can end in sorrow.

verses.kjv: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
verses.ct: The unfaithful person will get what their conduct deserves, and a good person will be rewarded for theirs.

verses.kjv: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.
verses.ct: A naive person believes anything they hear, but a sensible person thinks carefully about each step.

verses.kjv: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.
verses.ct: A wise person is cautious and turns away from evil, but a fool charges ahead recklessly with overconfidence.

verses.kjv: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
verses.ct: A quick-tempered person acts foolishly, and someone who schemes with evil intentions is despised.

verses.kjv: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
verses.ct: The naive end up with nothing but foolishness, but the sensible are rewarded with knowledge.

verses.kjv: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
verses.ct: Evil people will bow down before the good, and the wicked will stand at the gates of the righteous.

verses.kjv: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.
verses.ct: Poor people are disliked even by their own neighbors, but the wealthy have plenty of friends.

verses.kjv: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.
verses.ct: Anyone who looks down on their neighbor sins, but whoever shows mercy to the poor will be blessed.

verses.kjv: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
verses.ct: Don't those who plot evil go astray? But mercy and truth belong to those who plan what is good.

verses.kjv: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
verses.ct: All hard work leads to profit, but endless talk only leads to poverty.

verses.kjv: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.
verses.ct: The wealth of the wise is their crown, but the stupidity of fools only produces more foolishness.

verses.kjv: A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.
verses.ct: An honest witness saves lives, but a lying witness speaks nothing but deception.

verses.kjv: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.
verses.ct: Wholehearted dedication to the LORD gives powerful confidence, and his children will find a safe refuge.

verses.kjv: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
verses.ct: Wholehearted dedication to the LORD is a spring of life, turning a person away from the traps of death.

verses.kjv: In the multitude of people is the king’s honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.
verses.ct: A large population is a king's glory, but a ruler without people faces ruin.

verses.kjv: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
verses.ct: A patient person has great insight, but someone with a short temper promotes foolishness.

verses.kjv: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.
verses.ct: A peaceful heart gives life to the body, but jealousy rots the bones.

verses.kjv: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.
verses.ct: Whoever exploits the poor insults their Maker, but whoever shows mercy to the needy honors him.

verses.kjv: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.
verses.ct: The wicked are brought down by their own evil, but the righteous have hope even in death.

verses.kjv: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.
verses.ct: Wisdom rests quietly in the mind of someone with understanding, but among fools it must announce itself.

verses.kjv: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.
verses.ct: Righteousness lifts up a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.

verses.kjv: The king’s favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
verses.ct: A king is pleased with a capable servant, but his anger falls on one who brings shame.
